eventName: The Black Forest Wills A Dream
storyInfo: The gang stops at the settlement of a friendly forest tribe and stays overnight. That night, Magallan dreams of herself becoming the prey of a shadow. Santalla helps the tribe conduct a ritual that rouses their clan tree, which rises to begin its journey with its subjects, casting a shadow that Magallan finds somewhat familiar.

attributes.content: Breathe in—
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hffff—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Breath out—
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Phew—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Here. Eat this.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Okay—Gah, so sour...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: At least it's edible, right? You'll get used to it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: And here. This too.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Awgh—Huh? How come this nut is hollow?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Like a bubble?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mm... yeah.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The locals call them 'bubbles.' You hardly feel anything when you eat them, but they're very important for climbing these mountains.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Do you feel better now? Does your head still hurt?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mm—I'm fine now. These fruits and nuts are way better than altitude sickness pills, at least.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: So do you know how they work?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No. But does it really matter, as long as they do?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Of course it does. I gotta jot this down and bring some samples back with me. My colleagues in pharmaceutical R&D would love to hear about this.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Did you bring any of those pills?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: For altitude sickness? Of course.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You should take a look at the active ingredients.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Rummages through baggage)
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Here they are!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Main ingredients... wild sourberries and bubblenut extract... You mean...?!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: One of Sami's primary exports to Columbia is raw medicinal ingredients.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Although I hear your company plans to cut off all trade with us as soon as they figure out how to synthesize or cultivate them themselves.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Unfortunately for them, that will never happen. Not with something from Sami.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: You're saying we can't recreate the growth conditions in Columbia?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No, of course you can. But even if you did, what sprouts from the soil wouldn't be the same plants.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: For one very simple reason.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Because everything is provided by Sami.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (In Sami) Everything is provided by Sami.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In broken Sami) Everything... provided... by Sami?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You pick up languages quickly. When we first met, you needed Simone to translate for you whenever you wanted to say something about Sami.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hehe~
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Your Columbian's not bad at all either.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Arges speaks it well. That's why I can manage.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I see the tree line. The mountainfolk won't bother us anymore.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Phew, finally. A place to have a good meal.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Do trees mean better food?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The mountains have meat, but no fruit.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The forest is different. There are all kinds of food there. Anything you could want to eat.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Whoa.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (Pulls out notes and starts writing) 'Forest has abundant resources...'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Typhon, is there a settlement nearby?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yes, and it's a tribe with a tree.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Then they must have lived here in peace for many years.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: A tribe with a tree? What does that mean?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Each forest tribe has their own clan tree.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: ...If they don't, then they must either be up-and-coming, or they managed to lose even their tree. Whichever the case, it's laughable.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Will this tribe listen to us?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I believe they're quite friendly.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But either way, I can guarantee they will be more welcoming than the mountain tribes.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huh? Really?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Of course. The mountain warriors fight the monsters in the north and the unfriendly Ursus all year round, so you can't blame them for being so uptight.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Some of them are less cold when they leave the frontlines for home.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Well, that's good to hear.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: So, how do the Sami usually categorize themselves?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's pretty easy to remember. The ones farthest to the north who live in the mountains are the mountainfolk, the ones who live in the middle in the forest and its surroundings are the forestfolk, and the ones who live in the wetlands to the far south are the marshfolk.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What about you, then?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Me? I'm a hunter?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: A hunter? Uh, going by the classifications you just gave me, shouldn't it be based on what environment you're from?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Oh, that... I'm a Sarkaz. I don't have a fixed place to live, and I don't belong to a tribe. So naturally, I live outside the rules.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Then what about Simone?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Simone...? She—
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'm a Rhodes Islander.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Rhodes? I've never heard of an island like that here.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Is Rhodes Island another category here?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Here we are.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Whoa—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: This tree... It's like... a vertical nomadic city!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I-I've never seen—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: —I've gotta take a picture.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It doesn't seem so different from last time, but—
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Why does it look like they're all moving things outside?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (In Sami) Welcome, friends.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Thank you for your hospitality, Attendant of the Tree. We came from the north. Would it be convenient for us to stay the night?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Of course, honorable shaman. We always enjoy receiving guests. In any other circumstances, your arrival would be reason enough for a feast.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Alas, as you can see, we are preparing to move from this land that has long been our home. We leave on the morrow.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) You will find many of our houses on the Tree empty tonight. You and your companions may pick any of them to rest in. The Tree won't mind.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) I thank the Tree and your tribe for your generosity.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) You are very welcome. Please, come in.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Once you have settled down, please come to the ancestral home at the top of the Tree. We may have need of your wisdom.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: We have their permission to stay the night. Let's pick... the house closest to the branch there.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Hah... Finally, sleeping indoors.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Is that important?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: How else can you rest easy? Otherwise, you're up all night from worry.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Is that so... That's awfully picky of you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: It's not. Let me explain—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Waterproof pad... sleeping bag... there!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Pft.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What's so funny?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hm? Oh, I just thought it was amusing that you put in all this effort just to sleep.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: We don't get this chance every day, so I'm gonna make the most of it and get as comfy as I can.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Want to try it yourself?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Me? No need. As long as I have my robe to wrap myself in, I can sleep anywhere.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I mean, sure, you could... But you could also get in this sleeping bag and close your eyes. It's sooo comfortable, you'll see.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Can't hurt to give it a try, can it?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Alright...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hup...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Just squeeze yourself in there. I won't zip it up.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Mm, it's soft. Like beast skin... But it feels lighter than that...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mmm...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: These are our rations for tonight.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Alright, thanks. You can leave Typhon's over here.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What's wrong with her?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I had her try out my sleeping bag, and she fell asleep, just like that.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I need to step out for a second and speak with the shaman here.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: If you want to go outside, you should take Typhon with you.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: The forestfolk may be friendlier, but they won't appreciate it if you don't follow their rules.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Okay, got it.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Have a safe trip, Simone!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hey... Typhon. Typhon?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: She seems pretty exhausted.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I'll just take a few photos from the doorway...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (In Sami) You requested my presence, ma'am?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Yes, yes. Thank goodness you've come.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Allow me to explain the situation. As you can see, we are preparing to move.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) We encountered some trouble on our journey from the mountains. Are you facing similar issues here?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Indeed, indeed.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Thankfully, there are no victims yet, but my tribesmen tell me of a number of ill omens we've received.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Most importantly, there's this.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) 'Korona,' 'Hreidr.'
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Samivilinn is clear. Regardless of the reason, my tribe must depart for a more suitable home.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) I understand.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) But then, why did you summon me...?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Please take a look at this.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) I mustn't. This is your tribe's register.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) I am an outsider.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) I understand your concerns, my friend.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) I've lived in this forest ever since I was a child. As did my father, his father, and all of our ancestors.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) But because we have lived such quiet, comfortable lives for so long, this register has become barely more than a symbol for us, an inheritance.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) When I flip it open, I find myself unable to understand all of its words.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) I've studied it with my family, and communicated with my ancestors in hopes of understanding of the symbols within.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) But I feel as though we are still missing something.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) You are a shaman too, are you not?
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) I was.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) As long as you were once, your wisdom will undoubtedly be of assistance to us, friend.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Please have a look. We need your advice.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: Hah!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Sleeping bags are actually pretty comfortable...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Magallan!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Strange... Where is she?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Things seem pretty noisy outside...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hm... 'Outlander...' 'touching the clan tree'?!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh no, it has to be that birdbrain!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Speak.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'm sorry! I knew I couldn't take samples, but I had no idea I wasn't even supposed to touch it!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The tribe's tree is their oldest, most respected presence. Under normal circumstances, an outsider wouldn't even get the chance to stay in their tree houses.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Would you touch an ancient monument for no good reason? That, or... Do you have any wise elders where you're from?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hm... The President?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: President, okay. If you were to run up to your president and touch their face, how would others react?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'd probably be tackled to the ground by secret service agents before I got within ten feet of him...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's like that, then.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Luckily, these people are peaceful. All they've done is talk behind your back. If we were anywhere more hotheaded, they might have taken an axe to your head.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Simone told you to take me with you when you go outside. How could you forget?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I just wanted to take a few pictures, but the tree looked like it had a nice texture, so I wanted to see it up close, and...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Wait, huh? You heard what she said? Weren't you asleep?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I could hear her while asleep.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Th-Then how come you didn't wake up when I called your name?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Because I was asleep.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Anyway, you've learned your lesson. Don't get hung up on it. Do you want to try some tasty fruits and nuts?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: They have any here?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I saw a lot of them in the forest.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Come, we'll pick as many as we can. Enough for Simone too. We can eat them on the road tomorrow.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mm-hmm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You two are back?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Mmhmm!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: We got some fresh fruits. Do you want any, Simone?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mmmmmm?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: We should rest now.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Magallan.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Mmm?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Typhon, what did you feed her?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It wasn't me. She picked some nuts and asked if they were poisonous. I said no, and before I could even finish, she'd stuffed her mouth full of them.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Silencing chestnuts?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You should rest, then. A good night's sleep ought to fix it.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Good night.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Good night, Simone.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mm mmmmm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Mmmm!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You keep the sleeping bag. I don't need it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Sweet dreams.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Magallan can still remember how fluffy and warm her sleeping bag was, and how rhythmic the breathing of those around her was.
It was a quiet, comfortable environment, just perfect for resting.
But the moment she opens her eyes, she finds herself in the forest.
A blanket of greenery drapes over her waist. The trees around her have shrouded the moonlight above. It is completely dark all around.
She feels thirsty, so she follows the sound of water to a stream. She bends down to drink from it.
Nothing is out of the ordinary. Everything is exactly as it should be, even when she sees the reflection in the water.
Even if the reflection in the water is that of—
A musbeast.
*Squeak*
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The night is dark, quiet, and full of terrors. Magallan instinctively senses danger. She quickly lies down and breezes through the bushes before climbing onto the tree marked with her secretions, the nest she calls home.
*Squeak*!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It is safe there. There, she will find her kin, her family. She stands on the tree branch and squeals, waiting for a reply.
Nothing.
She hesitates a little, but in the end hops onto the tree trunk and back into her nest.
There, her mother is fast asleep in the shadows.
She wants to snuggle up to her, to get through the night in her embrace, but once her eyes adjust to the darkness, she finds only a scattered pile of beast bones.
The nest is very wide and very dark, almost like there's something waiting for her.
Waiting for her to come home.
Waiting for her to lower her guard.
Waiting for her to be overwhelmed by fear.
Something climbs onto the back of her neck—
Mm... ugh...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The nightmare left Magallan feeling sick. She wants to walk out the door, catch her breath, and calm herself down before going back to sleep.
But the moment she steps outside, what she sees makes her doubt that she has actually awoken from her dream.
There is a large, shadowy entity roaming here.
It looks like a person, and also kind of like a tree. The large shadow is moving in a single direction at a slow yet steady pace.
The entity shrouds even the moon above, keeping the ground below out of the moonlight's reach.
What... is this?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I need to get a picture of it.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: *Click*—
Th-That's not possible. It makes no sense!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: In the photo she just took, the shadow was nowhere to be seen and the moonlight illuminates the ground. Everything looks perfectly normal.
But the shadow stills moves before her eyes.
Without a sound.
Magallan stands rooted to the spot.
She doesn't know if she should head back inside to sleep as if nothing had happened...
...Or go grab her equipment and measure this possibly unrecordable supernatural phenomenon as best she can.
Just as she finds herself lost in thought, the enormous shadow sweeps past her. She instinctively jumps back, and at the same time—
Something climbs onto the back of her neck—
What are you doing out here?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Ah!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: *sigh* Relax, Magallan. Calm down. I'm here. Nothing here is going to hurt you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huff... Haah... Phew...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Don't try talk yet. Calm down first.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mmm...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Have a seat, and drink some water. It doesn't matter how big that guy is. It's just a shadow.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huff... huff—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Feeling any better?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mm, thanks. You almost scared me to death.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You're stronger than I expected. I was looking forward to you screaming loud enough to wake everyone up.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Are they going to kick me out of the village tonight, then?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No, no. The Sami aren't that narrow-minded.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...Had a nightmare?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Let me guess. One where a beastling cub goes home, finds its mother's bones, and then gets eaten?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Did you have the same dream?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Yep. Just this afternoon in your sleeping bag.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's not your fault. It comes whenever I rest in a safe, relaxing environment.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Like an unwelcome friend.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: This is one of the bad things about Sami. The cycle of hunt or be hunted never ends, even in your dreams.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: And in dreams, most find themselves on the side of the hunted...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Then... can we become the hunters?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Wouldn't you rather be the rules themselves?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Is that even possible...?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Who knows?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Maybe it is.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Once we become more mature...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: When we're no longer afraid of these big guys.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Magallan, why don't we try touching it?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huh? Isn't that dangerous?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I thought you were an explorer? Why are you so afraid?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I only ever set out after I've planned for every possible contingency, but how am I supposed to prepare for this?!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: S-Stop pulling—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Aghhh! We stepped on the tree!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's not the main trunk. Stepping on it a little won't hurt.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Besides, no one's around to see.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hup.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: This is a great spot. Let's sit here.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: A-Are you sure we're not too close?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: How are we supposed to touch it from far away?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Are we... really going to touch it?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's just a shadow. There's nothing to be scared of.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Or to exact, it's only a shadow for now. A very, very faint one.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Maybe one day it will grow into a more concrete threat, but we'll have grown too. We'll have even more tricks up our sleeves.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: So when that time comes, maybe these things won't be so scary to us anymore.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Besides, I can sometimes hear a voice in that dream where we're preyed on.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: 'If something ever scares you, you should attack it without hesitation.'
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: 'If you defeat it, you will have defeated fear. If you run from it, you will always be afraid.'
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Come.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Magallan uneasily looks at the curtain-like shadow before her.
The cruel and oppressive feeling she felt in her dream still haunts her mind.
Part of her tells her not to take the risk, but—
She slowly reaches her hand out.
Just like that. Slowly. It'll be fine.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'll do it with you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Typhon places her palm on the back of Magallan's hand and gently pushes it forward.
The moment they're met with a hint of resistance, she stops pushing forward, and instead reaches forward ahead of Magallan's hand.
She dips her hand into the shadow and pulls it back out. Then, she places it back on Magallan's hand.
See? Nothing to be afraid of.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Mm... I'll give it a try...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Magallan's hand inches forward bit by bit, until her fingertips are finally submerged in the shadow.
She thought she would feel a hint of cold, or perhaps that something would suck her in or chew on her fingers.
But there was nothing.
Nothing.
First, up to a joint. Then, a whole finger. Finally, her whole hand.
The shadow still moves, but aside from the change in the light, nothing happens at all.
Exactly as Typhon said.
It's just a shadow.
How is it? Just like I said, right?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You're right... There's nothing.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hm... How did something like this happen in the first place...?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Still hung up on those scientific principles of yours?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Things don't just happen without rhyme or reason.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Mm-hm.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Then how come our mothers gave birth to you and me, and not to anybody else?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Based on your logic, isn't that something with no rhyme or reason?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: W-Well, that's because...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It seems like you southerners really need to have a reason for everything.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But if you ask me, I think it's more important to be able to face the unknown at any time.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Even if I'm not prepared.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Don't you... get scared?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Do you? When you encounter a blizzard in the icefield, an avalanche in the mountains, or a pack of beasts when you're alone?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I do, yeah... but I still think I'll manage to survive somehow.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: If you can manage to survive even when you're scared, you've already accomplished the most difficult thing there is.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: And in that case, what else is there to be afraid of?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Even if the shadow in front of us were to suddenly turn into a real monster, you wouldn't be afraid, would you?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: If it were something that actually exists, we could deal with it. This? This is just a shadow.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Everything that exists has a weak point.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You wait, observe, and survive until the moment you find that weakness, and then you attack. That's how hunters have always lived.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You're an explorer, so you're something like half a hunter. I'm sure you can handle these things, too.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Nothing stays the same forever. Maybe there will come a day when the things that once scared you are afraid of you instead.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Don't overthink it. We have to be on the road tomorrow.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, right. Here.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Want a fruit before you go back to bed?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: No thanks. Eating sugar before bed is how you get cavities.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Alright, up to you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Good night.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Nighty-night, Typhon.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Magallan turns around and looks at the hovering shadow once more.
But for some reason, she doesn't think it represents fear and emptiness this time.
It feels more like a traveler who has lost his bearings and doesn't know where to go. Simply wandering the lands aimlessly.
Maybe, by the time the sun rises, it will have gone back home for a good night's sleep.
*Click*—
Magallan takes another picture. Just like before, there is nothing in the photograph.
She thinks a little, and adds a note on the picture.
'Mr. Lonesome.'
Finally, everything is quiet once more.
Only the wandering shadow is left to hover around alone.
Until daybreak.
It should almost be time.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I wonder what kind of ceremony this is.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Ooh, it's starting!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (Takes out her notebook) 'The Sami begin the ceremony by singing and dancing around their clan tree. Perhaps this is meant to be a farewell to the tree.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Ten minutes later...
Hmm...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'The dance is very unique, but disorderly. Everyone dances on their own.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'It's almost like a carnival.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Thirty minutes later...
(Yawns)
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Is Simone here yet?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, she's right under the tree, talking to the shaman.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: If you wanna look, I can lend you my binoculars.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No thanks. My eyes are enough to see her without your gadget.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What kind of ceremony is this, anyway? And how much longer will it take? If you hadn't come, I'd have fallen asleep by now.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I'm a Sami Sarkaz, not a Sami Elafia. I don't know much more than you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: As for how long it will take, that's hard to say. I've seen ceremonies that ended with just the shaman's nod, as well as gatherings that lasted all day and night.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But forget the ceremony. Take a look at this. I found it in the forest!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Is this... a snowball?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's Amma's Affection, Magallan! This is Amma's Affection!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Amma? That means 'mother,' right?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Good memory.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: As a southerner might put it, this is a mother's love.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: It's the protection most sought after by the Sami. Among all of Sami's kindnesses, it's the purest and most sincere.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Here, take it Magallan. Put it in your pocket.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Didn't you just say all the Sami want this? You found it, so you should keep it. I can't take it.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I know its worth, but that's why I don't have the right to it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Amma doesn't like granting protection to greedy people.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But you know nothing about her. Ignorance is also a kind of purity, and you have an honest soul. That's why you should have it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Then... what should I do with it?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Forget about it, like you never received it in the first place.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Then I gotta give you something in return, too.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hold on...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Here you go, Li'l Typhoon.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What did you just call me?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...Never mind. So what is this?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: A flare. Just twist open the lid and pull the string, and it'll let out a ton of light and noise. You're a hunter; I'm sure can think of a use.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: That does sound pretty useful. I'll try it out next time.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huh? Magallan, they stopped dancing. Aren't you taking notes? Quick!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huh? Oh! Okay!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (Pulls out notebook) 'After forty straight minutes of independent carnival, the ceremony has moved onto its next phase.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'The shaman shows the tribesmen a woodcarving.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'She says something impassioned.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'Then, she raises her wooden staff, faces the clan tree, and sounds the horn. Then she starts murmuring something.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'There is another shaman assisting her by her side, like she is singing an accompaniment.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Typhon, can you help me out and figure out what they're saying?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I can't understand it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The tone is familiar, but those are clearly not words you use in normal conversation.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (Jots notes) 'Some sort of ritualistic language.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: She's repeating a few short words over and over.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: 'Repeating...'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'Her emotions build up, and she keeps raising her voice—'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: W-What's going on?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: An earthquake? Typhon?! Where should we evacuate to?!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No... Magallan...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Look... The tree...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (In Sarkaz) My god.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hmm...?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The tree's roots begin to emerge as it gradually lifts off the ground.
A thunderous sound rings through the forest and suppresses the shouts of everyone underneath.
Surrounded by other trees, it slowly rises into the air as its roots wring together into a bundle and form an unprecedented—in human terms—mobile structure.
Its leaves come falling down from the canopy, but the Sami are not shocked in the slightest. Instead, they appear very excited.
Indeed, what could be more encouraging than your tribe's ancestral tree lifting itself from the ground along with all the clan's history and memories?
(In Sami) Congratulations, Attendant. The ritual was a success.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) I've always thought my ancestors' journey with the Tree was a mere tale.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Thank you, child of the Santalla Tree. Without your interpretation and assistance, this awakening ceremony would not have been successful.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) The Tree has awakened, but It still awaits a direction and Its next steps from us. I must research our tribe register more.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) With the Tree's enormous body out in the open, the disaster of the north is bound to notice it.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Their activity has been growing more and more frequent of late. You must pray for Sami to protect the Tree with you.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Yes. Yes, you are right.
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Please make your way to the south with all haste and replant the Tree. Do not let yourselves get caught up in them.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Understood. Hm... The register says...
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Well, then. My companions and I must take our leave. I pray that Sami will find you and your tribe a satisfactory destination, such that you need never relocate again.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Oh, are you leaving so soon?
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) You still have much to attend to. No need to see us off.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) Then I wish you and your companions a safe and uneventful journey. Once again, I thank you kindly for your help, honored friend... Oh... I see... To make the Tree set out, I must first...
attributes.name: Forest Shaman

attributes.content: (In Sami) Farewell.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Report.
(Imitating the Ursus Messenger's voice) I have entered Sami as planned. Please advise on the positions of Liebafowl and the Black Mark. Over.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Simone, Simone!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm back.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Is there something I can help you with?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It's time to go.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'm sorry that took so long.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It's okay. Let's go.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Simone, you really need to explain to me what she said during the ritual. It's going to be real important to my research!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I'll tell you all about it on the way.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Sounds good.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What's the matter?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Nothing. I'll be done real quick!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: *Click*—
Before she leaves, Magallan snaps a picture of the enormous tree standing in the forest.
For some reason, she feels that this gigantic being almost completely blocking the sun looks kind of familiar—
She doesn't think too much about it, and merely scribbles her immediate thoughts into her notebook.
Then, she follows the rest of the group and continue their journey to southern Sami.
